trans-unit.source: Open the shared project file MainPage.cs and add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:
trans-unit.target: Open the shared project file MainPage.cs and add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:

trans-unit.source: This code authenticates the user with a Facebook login.
trans-unit.target: This code authenticates the user with a Facebook login.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider other than Facebook, change the value of **MobileServiceAuthenticationProvider** above to the value for your provider.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider other than Facebook, change the value of **MobileServiceAuthenticationProvider** above to the value for your provider.

trans-unit.source: Comment-out or delete the call to the **RefreshTodoItems** method in the existing **OnNavigatedTo** method override.
trans-unit.target: Comment-out or delete the call to the **RefreshTodoItems** method in the existing **OnNavigatedTo** method override.

trans-unit.source: This prevents the data from being loaded before the user is authenticated.
trans-unit.target: This prevents the data from being loaded before the user is authenticated.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will add a **Sign in** button to the app that triggers authentication.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will add a **Sign in** button to the app that triggers authentication.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Store app project, open the MainPage.xaml project file and add the following **Button** element just before the element that defines the **Save** button:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Store app project, open the MainPage.xaml project file and add the following **Button** element just before the element that defines the **Save** button:

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Phone Store app project, add the following **Button** element in the **ContentPanel**, after the **TextBox** element:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Phone Store app project, add the following **Button** element in the **ContentPanel**, after the **TextBox** element:

trans-unit.source: Open the shared App.xaml.cs project file and add the following code:
trans-unit.target: Open the shared App.xaml.cs project file and add the following code:

trans-unit.source: If the **OnActivated** method already exists, just add the `#if...#endif` code block.
trans-unit.target: If the **OnActivated** method already exists, just add the `#if...#endif` code block.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the Windows Store app, click the **Sign in** button, and sign into the app with your chosen identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the Windows Store app, click the **Sign in** button, and sign into the app with your chosen identity provider.

trans-unit.source: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query your Mobile App and make updates to data.
trans-unit.target: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query your Mobile App and make updates to data.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Windows Phone Store app project, click **Set as StartUp Project**, then repeat the previous step to verify that the Windows Phone Store app also runs correctly.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Windows Phone Store app project, click **Set as StartUp Project**, then repeat the previous step to verify that the Windows Phone Store app also runs correctly.
